intro: Coccoloba ovata var. lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and the Gulf Coast. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant, pinkish-white flowers. It produces showy, violet-blue berries that are an important food source for birds. This plant thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
